page.title: 09THE WATER TOWER
page.content: An act of Parliament in 1878 secured a perpetual{supply of water}to Westhoughton at 6d(2.5p)per 1000 gallons.The minimum to be paid for is 50,000 gallons a day and the maximum we are entitled to is 400,000 galls. Prior to 1915 there were complaints of a poor water supply.{Councillor {Basnett}stated that North Ward could never get sufficient water on{Mondays} (washing day).As a result a water tank was built at{Snydale Hill}.The top water level was at 530ft and gave a constant water pressure throughout Westhoughton.The tank's{capacity}was 200,000 galls(1 day's supply).In 1980 an{underground reservoir}was completed making the old tower obselete.It was sold and plans were passed to{convert {it into a dwelling}.This has never been completed.It stands,its top removed, falling into decay.
